snippet: Judge Douglas P. Woodlock of United States District Court said he wanted to find juries in Boston for the trials of three friends of Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, the marathon bombing suspect.
abstract: Federal Judge Douglas P Woodlock says he wants to try to find juries in Boston for the trials of three friends of Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, suspect in 2013 marathon bombings; indicates that if impartial jurors cannot be found, he might seek a jury from Springfield, Mass, about 90 miles west.
lead_paragraph: Judge Douglas P. Woodlock of United States District Court said he wanted to find juries in Boston for the trials of three friends of Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, the marathon bombing suspect.

headline.main: Judge Wants Trials for 3 in Bombing Case to Stay in Boston
headline.print_headline: Judge Seeks to Avoid Moving Bombing Trials From Boston
